title.narrative: Improved access to nutritious food for People Living with HIV and AIDs (PLWHAs) in Yambio and Rimenzi WE

description.narrative:
This is a six months bridging project while final decision on partnership is being made. The project intended to Improved access to nutritious food for People Living with HIV and AIDs (PLWHAs) in Yambio and Rimenzi Payams Western Equatoria. It is designed to directly benefit 500 households (3,000 individuals) of People Living with HIV and AIDs (PLWHA) in two Payams of Yambio and Rimenzi of Gbudwe State, Western Equatoria. And will indirectly benefit an estimated 6,000 people. Main components of the project will be vegetable and poultry inputs and tools, accompanied by improvement in skills of beneficiaries on both vegetables production and poultry management through trainings, awareness raising and nutrition education.
The project will be implemented by CTP partner Catholic Organization for Development and Peace (CODEP). CODEP is the aid and development wing of the Catholic Diocese of Tombura – Yambio. CODEP is currently implementing CTP support HIV exit strategy project. The project will be ending in October 2017. This project is therefore drawn up from lessons learned from the current project during the monitoring activities and is intended to consolidate achievements already gained through the current running project. The project will run for the period of six months beginning November 1st, 2017 and ending in April 30th, 2018. During the implementation, CTP will work with partner staff to strengthen their skills in the following areas: Development of monitoring plan and monitoring tools; VIA analysis; Post Distribution Monitoring (PDM); Monitoring and Evaluation.
